billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO HOUSING, CONSTRUCTION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

title: Provides preferences in certain public housing projects for certain service in the armed forces
summary: Provides preferences in certain public housing projects for certain service in the armed forces; provides recipients of expeditionary medals in Vietnam, Lebanon, Grenada, Panama and Persian Gulf conflict same preference to public housing as Vietnam veterans.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2654

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 27, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Housing, Construction  and
         Community Development

       AN  ACT  to  amend the public housing law, in relation to preferences in
         admission to certain housing projects

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subparagraph 1 of paragraph b of subdivision 1 of section
    2  156 of the public housing law, as amended by chapter 179 of the laws  of
    3  2006, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (1)  have served in the armed forces of the United States for a period
    5  of at least six months (or any shorter period which  terminated  due  to
    6  death  or injury incurred in such service), provided some portion of the
    7  period of service was [between the twenty-eighth day of February,  nine-
    8  teen  hundred  sixty-one  to  the  seventh  day of May, nineteen hundred
    9  seventy-five] (I) DURING THE HOSTILITIES KNOWN AS THE  VIETNAM  CONFLICT
   10  WHICH  COMMENCED  THE  TWENTY-EIGHTH  DAY  OF FEBRUARY, NINETEEN HUNDRED
   11  SIXTY-ONE AND TERMINATED ON THE SEVENTH DAY  OF  MAY,  NINETEEN  HUNDRED
   12  SEVENTY-FIVE;  OR (II) WAS THE RECIPIENT OF THE ARMED FORCES EXPEDITION-
   13  ARY MEDAL, NAVY EXPEDITIONARY MEDAL, OR MARINE CORPS EXPEDITIONARY MEDAL
   14  FOR PARTICIPATION IN OPERATIONS IN VIETNAM; OR (III)  IN  OPERATIONS  IN
   15  LEBANON FROM THE FIRST DAY OF JUNE, NINETEEN HUNDRED EIGHTY-THREE TO THE
   16  FIRST  DAY  OF DECEMBER, NINETEEN HUNDRED EIGHTY-SEVEN; OR (IV) IN OPER-
   17  ATIONS IN GRENADA FROM THE TWENTY-THIRD DAY OF OCTOBER, NINETEEN HUNDRED
   18  EIGHTY-THREE TO THE  TWENTY-FIRST  DAY  OF  NOVEMBER,  NINETEEN  HUNDRED
   19  EIGHTY-THREE;  OR  (V) IN OPERATIONS IN PANAMA FROM THE TWENTIETH DAY OF
   20  DECEMBER, NINETEEN HUNDRED EIGHTY-NINE TO THE THIRTY-FIRST DAY OF  JANU-
   21  ARY,  NINETEEN  HUNDRED  NINETY; OR (VI) IN THE HOSTILITIES KNOWN AS THE
   22  PERSIAN GULF CONFLICT WHICH COMMENCED THE SECOND DAY OF AUGUST, NINETEEN
   23  HUNDRED NINETY TO THE END OF SUCH HOSTILITIES, and
   24    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07574-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public housing law, in relation to preferences in admission to certain housing projects
